linking.title: Ingress account linking
linking.none: No account linked to your Bannergress profile

step1.title: 1. What's your Agent name?
step1.description: Make sure it's spelled correctly, otherwise we won't be able to verify it.

step2.title: 2. Copy the message
step2.description: We have generated a message for you that allows to link "{{agent}}" to your account. You need to copy this message for the next step.

step3.title: 3. Send the message
step3.description: You need to send the message to the Ingress in-game cross-faction chat. After that, it may take some time until the account linking is complete. Please be patient.

help.markdown:
You can use basic Markdown in this field. The following formatting options are supported:

  • **bold**
  • *italic*
  • paragraphs
  • [hyperlinks](https://example.org)
  • lists: 
    - list entry
- list entry

help.banner: Banner: Collection of missions that must be completed in sequence to complete the picture in your profile.
help.collection: Collection: Collection of missions that can be completed in any order as they don't form a picture.

errors.noMissions: A banner must contain an accepted mission
errors.numberOfMissions: A banner must contain between {{min}} and {{max}} missions
errors.invalidIndex: There are at least a mission with an invalid index. Indexes must be positive integers
errors.titleLength: The title must be between {{min}} and {{max}} characters

warnings.incomplete: The banner could be incomplete, as it has gaps
warnings.divisible: The banner could be incomplete, as the number of missions is not divisible by the selected width: {{width}}
warnings.length: The banner could be incomplete, as the length differs from the detected length in the title: {{length}}

algorithm.help:
Manual: Title will be detected automatically from missions. Mission numbering will be sequential starting from 1.

Automatic: Automatic title/numbering detection. With long banners could be slower.

  • If detection is changed to automatic, title and numbering may change as it will be reevaluated.
  • If title is changed manually, it won't be changed automatically when new missions are added.
  • If a mission number is changed manually, Manual detection will be activated.

time.title: In-game Time
time.warning: No time available because some missions are offline, missing or have not been completed by any agent

errors.noPois: Banner has no POIs currently available
errors.loading: Error loading recent banners, please try again later

question1.title: What is bannergress.com?
question1.answer:
After the horrific loss of our favorite Ingress fan page, some agents came together to start this project. The aim of the project is to:

  • get everyone involved
  • be open source
  • be the long-term solution for finding banners
  • never stop developing

question2.title: How do I get Ingress missions to bannergress.com? (Part 1: setup)
question2.answer:
1. Install IITC-CE (Recommendation: IITC Button browser add-on)
  2. Install the bannergress plugin
    Caution: If you use a userscript manager parallel to the IITC browser add-on, you‚Äôre getting two tabs with installations; Install the plugin in the IITC Button view tab
  3. Click on the IITC icon in your browser and make sure the following two plugins are active:
    • Misc > Bannergress
    • Info > Missions
  4. Refresh (F5) your IITC
  5. Open Bannergress settings
    You can find this link at the end of the right sidebar
  6. You have to log in first with your Google account
    Click on Log in button

Now you are ready to scan missions! (Part 2)

question3.title: How do I get Ingress missions to bannergress.com? (Part 2: scan missions)
question3.answer:
1. Open your IITC-CE
  2. Go to the area which you want to scan
  3. Zoom very closely in mission dense areas
    Caution: Only Top 25 missions will be shown!
  4. Open Missions in view
    You can find this link at the end of the right sidebar
  5. A new window with Bannergress utilities on the top and a mission list including status (Only Top 25!) should be opened.
    Now you can scan the missions in different ways:
    • The fastest way to get many missions uploaded is to Process all!
    • If you explicitly want to upload one banner: use the Filter by mission name
    • You can also upload single missions with the ü†ã on the right
  6. Navigate with the map controls (‚ÄúN‚Äù, ‚ÄúE‚Äù, S‚Äù, ‚ÄúW‚Äù) and repeat step 5
    We do get only missions if you hit a button!

question4.title: How can I add a banner to bannergress?
question4.answer:
1. You have to be logged in
  2. You can find Submit a new banner on our landing page (Home)
  3. New banner
      Add Missions:
      search for the banner name or author.
      Pro Tip: You can use % for a placeholder
      You can add all or add specific missions with the ‚ûî
      Arrange:
      The website tries to arrange the missions automatically.
      You can always edit the mission numbers manually.
      If the missions can be finished in any order, check the advanced options in information
      Information:
      Please check the banner title, description and preview.
      Click on Review
      Review:
      You can see all banner information. If you are happy, click Submit Banner

question6.title: How do I get my own Ingress missions to bannergress.com, using the Ingress Mission Creator?
question6.answer:
1. You need either the IITC Button browser add-on or Tampermonkey.
  2. Install the bannergress creator plugin.
  3. Open the mission creator (you may be asked to log into your Ingress account). Then, click on ‚ÄúSync with Bannergress‚Äù in the menu (you may be asked to log into your Bannergress account).

question7.title: How can I edit my own banners?
question7.answer:
Bannergress needs to know your Ingress agent name before it can provide you with edit permissions:
  1. Sign into Bannergress.
  2. Open your Bannergress account page.
  3. Click on "Link Ingress Account" and follow the instructions.
After that, you have an edit button on all banners that you own.
